Reason: The configuration option 'enablePngCrush' is classified as performance-sensitive. This is because enabling 'enablePngCrush' directly impacts the execution of the 'dconvert' function by adding the PngCrush postprocessor to the list of postprocessors. The PngCrush optimization process can affect the processing time and output quality of the converted files, leading to notable performance variations at the system level. Additionally, the code context shows that the 'enablePngCrush' configuration triggers the instantiation and addition of the PngCrushProcessor during the execution process, further emphasizing its performance sensitivity.
